instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot after waterdmg
threads.message:
Hey i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  macbook.

I had a short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>. There was little corrosion under <SIGNAL>U3100_R</SIGNAL>.
I cleaned that and soldered back.
Short gone.
Alle seems good so far.

I tried DFU repair device. It stops with the dialog.

Gave up waiting for device to transition from DFU state to DFU state. [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore â€“ 0xFCA (4042).

What i can do now.
The mac is here for data recovery.
can i swap board? What did i need? Nands ? T2?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot after waterdmg
threads.message:
Was that error in revive option for sure?
Revive not always solves problems.

After changig <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, machine doesn't try to boot?
How to recover data, if you swap the board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot after waterdmg
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 102658, member: 682"]
Was that error in revive option for sure?
Revive not always solves problems.

After changig <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, machine doesn't try to boot?
How to recover data, if you swap the board?
[/QUOTE]
i just reballes i dont change <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>.
I am pretty sure why?
I can try tomorrow again and send a screenshot.


If the Logicboard is not repairable. How can i recover the data ? Just a question.
I work a lot on smartphones and do boardswaps. Transplant cpu nand eeprom to a new logicboard.
Is that an option on Macbooks?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot after waterdmg
threads.message:
Not at all.
Data is encrypted and encryption key is stored into T2.

Be aware, restore option will erase SSD.
However, sometime is no other option to recover the MLB.

That means DFU has been completed.
Was that done in revive, or restore?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot after waterdmg
threads.message:
Try different cable.
Some people claimed on Internet that original Apple cable didn't work.
Yu should have more cables for test.
When you get one working (maybe with other machine), note and keep it only for DFU purpose.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot after waterdmg
threads.message:
Is that revive, or restore?

Connect charger cabke before DFU cable.
Use 87W charger and try with battery connected too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot after waterdmg
threads.message:
i do revive. We need the data.

i tried all. Same error but sometimes i have apple logo with loading bar and fan is spinning.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot after waterdmg
threads.message:
The data may be compromised already.

Do you get progress bar only after trying DFU?
Check if is possible to start in target disk mode.
